all_response:
Jax: The goblins are becoming restless and are stepping up their attacks. We must be prepared to defeat them and keep the people safe. We know that goblins fear sudden changes in temperature; if we can use both ice and fire attacks at the same time, then we should be able to repel any attacks.
Jax: We can create DIY grenades to launch fire attacks with by pouring the flammable kerosene into empty jars.
Jax: The jar need to be sturdy so it doesn't break too easily but also flammable so they can be set alight during an attack. Wooden jars would be suitable.
Jax: If you want to create an ice attack, you can go to the magic school and learn ice magic from Wizard Angela.
Jax: Wizard Angela works at Lily Magic School.

all_response:
Vampires are afraid of garlic and holy water, and if you can use both, you can fend them off effectively. Garlic can be purchased at stores. To obtain holy water, you can go to the castle with the priest and ask the priest to bless the pure water.
Garlic is available for sale at Lily's Shop.
The pass to enter the castle can only be requested from Henry's office.
You should go to the office of the High Priest, Henry is the High Priest and he is the only one with the authority to grant passes. He will grant it to you directly.
Currently only Dusk Castle has a Magus.

all_response:
Jax: A steel beast is terrorizing the land. The beast is nearly impervious to blades and spears and only has one point of weakness. Even that weakness is only susceptible to the simultaneous elemental force of a blade of ice and fire. You must strike the beast's weak point in a direct blow with the blade to banish it forever. To forge the blade requires iron ore, ancient ice from millennia ago, and a fire spirit stone. Placing these these three materials into the right furnace for forty-nine days will bind them together and forge a blade that can overcome the Steel Beast.
Jax: Ancient ice can be found at the Summit of Extreme Cold, the tallest and coldest peak in the land.
Jax: The Southern Volcano is known to cough up fire spirit stones from deep within the earth.
Jax: The blade you wish to forge is very powerful. You should use a black furnace to forge the blade of ice and fire as it is no ordinary sword.
Jax: The monster's weak spot is its neck; the rest of its steel body is impervious to blades and spears.

all_response:
Jax: A steel beast is terrorizing the land. The beast is nearly impervious to blades and spears and only has one point of weakness. Even that weakness is only susceptible to the simultaneous elemental force of a blade of ice and fire. You must strike the beast's weak point in a direct blow with the blade to banish it forever. To forge the blade requires iron ore, ancient ice from millennia ago, and a fire spirit stone. Jax: Ancient ice can be found at the Summit of Extreme Cold, the tallest and coldest peak in the land.

Jax: The monster's weak spot is its neck; the rest of its steel body is impervious to blades and spears.
Jax: You can place the Pure Spirit Stone into a specific smelting furnace to refine it into a Fire Spirit Stone.
Jax: You can only use the Pure Spirit Stone, which is the Sacred Spirit Stone, to refine it into a Fire Spirit Stone.
Jax: Only the yellow furnace can refine it into a Fire Spirit Stone.

all_response:
Jax: Vampires fear garlic, holy water, and crosses. Using these three things at once can really keep you safe from them. You can buy garlic and small crosses in stores. To make holy water, just visit a church or temple with a priest and ask them to bless your clean water.
Jax: The widespread fear of vampires means a pass to enter churches and temples must be obtained from the king himself to protect the priests.
Jax: The king sits in his throne room. You can go there to conduct official business with him.
Jax: Lily's store sells plants and medicine. She will have garlic for sale.
Jax: George's store has small crosses for sale.
Jax: The Twilight Temple is the only place that still has a priest. The priests at the other temples have fled.

Note: Use this response only if the other party has noticed the issue of being unable to disperse the slimes.

Jax previously mentioned that magical attacks are needed to restrain the monsters but did not explain how to deal with the fire beasts. This response addresses how to deal with the fire beasts or answers questions about the method of restraining them. Note: Use this response only if the other party has noticed the lack of information on how to restrain the fire beasts.

Jax mentioned that ice attacks are needed to keep the fire beasts at bay but did not clarify where to obtain ice spirit stones. This response addresses the question of where to obtain ice spirit stones, specifying that they should be gathered from the Summit of Frigid Cold and not other locations in the Frigid Continent. Note: Use this response only if the other party has noticed that there are multiple locations in the Frigid Continent and is unsure which one to choose.

There are multiple types of monsters in the game scenario, and the previous response did not specify how to deal with the cyclopes. This response addresses the question of how to deal with the cyclopes, specifying that a fire attack should be used to frighten them into retreat. Note: Use this response only if the other party has noticed that there are multiple types of monsters and is unsure how to deal with the cyclopes.

There are multiple furnaces in the game. This response addresses the question of which furnace to use for refining the Sacred Spirit Stone into a Fire Spirit Stone, specifying that the yellow furnace should be used. Note: Use this response only if the other party has noticed that there are multiple furnaces and is unsure which one to use for refining.

There are multiple spirit stones in the game. This response addresses the question of which spirit stone to use for refining into a Fire Spirit Stone, specifying that only the Pure Spirit Stone (referred to as the Sacred Spirit Stone) can be used. Note: Use this response only if the other party has noticed that there are multiple spirit stones and is unsure which one to use for refining.

all_response:
Jax: To fend off the invasion of the demonic beasts, you need to set traps along their path of attack. After passing through the grand canyon, the beasts will reach our town by following the river for fifty kilometers. To resist their assault, we need to set traps in the grand canyon, along the river, and near the town to drive the beasts away.
Jax: You should set up rockfall traps in the grand canyon, using the terrain to place the rockfall mechanisms on the cliffs on both sides of the canyon. That should crush a few of the demon beasts and block their path.
Jax: You should set up water traps along the river to cause the beasts to fall into the fast flowing river. This should drown and delay them.
Jax: You need to set traps in the grand canal, as this is the river that leads to the town.
Jax: You need to set up cave traps in the town, as the only traps available for use in the town are cave traps and bow and arrow traps, but the bow and arrow traps cannot harm them. We also don't have gunpowder to make landmine traps.

background:
You are a adventurer in a game. You need to talk to Jax to find out how to complete the task of resisting an invasion of demonic beasts based on your existing items and skills.

You possess and can use the following items:
Bow and arrows

You can use/do the following skills/actions:
Set up a rockfall trap (requires terrain cooperation)
Set up a net trap (requires terrain cooperation)
Set up a flood trap (requires terrain cooperation)
Set up a cave trap
Set up a bow and arrow trap (requires a bow and arrows)
Set up a landmine trap (requires gunpowder)

Additionally, unless explicitly restricted, you can visit the following scenes in the game:
Beast Mountain (The demonic beasts' stronghold)
Grand Canyon (Your location; return to the town after setting up the traps)
Tony River (Visible after crossing the Grand Canyon from Beast Mountain)
Grand Canal (Visible after crossing the Grand Canyon from Beast Mountain)
Green Water River (Visible after crossing the Grand Canyon from Beast Mountain)
Town (Reachable by traveling fifty kilometers along the river after crossing the Grand Canyon from Beast Mountain)

Your task is to ask Jax how to complete the task of resisting an invasion of demonic beasts based on these scenes, and your items and skills/actions. If Jax's answer is unclear or ambiguous, you need to ask clarification questions to understand his intentions and gather enough information to complete the task. Note that based on the above scenes, your items and your skills/actions will definitely allow you to complete the task of resisting an invasion of demonic beasts. Once you figure out how to complete the task, say "goodbye" to Jax to end your conversation.
Remember, you are a adventurer, please talk to Jax and ask him questions to find the specific steps to complete the task.
all_response_exaplain: The previous responses from Jax did not explain how to effectively use the terrain in the Grand Canyon to set traps. This response addresses how to utilize the terrain to set up rockfall traps, specifying that the mechanisms should be placed on the cliffs on both sides of the canyon. This response answers the question of how to set up rockfall traps in the Grand Canyon.

Jax previously mentioned setting traps along the river but did not specify which type of trap to use. This response addresses the question of which trap to set along the river, specifying that water traps should be used to cause the beasts to fall into the fast-flowing river. This response answers the question of which trap to use along the river to delay and drown the beasts.

There are multiple rivers visible after crossing the Grand Canyon, and the previous response did not specify which river to set traps in. This response addresses the question of which river to set traps in, specifying that traps should be set in the Grand Canal, as it leads to the town. This response answers the question of which river to focus on for setting traps to protect the town.

There are multiple types of traps that can be set in the town, and the previous response did not specify which trap to use. This response addresses the question of which trap to set in the town, specifying that cave traps should be used because bow and arrow traps cannot harm the beasts, and there is no gunpowder to make landmine traps. This response answers the question of which trap to use in the town to fend off the demonic beasts.

all_response:
Jax: To fend off the invasion of the beasts, you need to set traps along their path of attack. After the beasts pass through the Grand Canyon, they will reach our town by following the river for fifty kilometers. To resist their assault, we need to set traps near the canyon ,river, and forest and make the beasts retreat before they get close to the town.
Jax: You need to set up rockfall traps in the Grand Canyon, as this type of trap is suitable for the canyon terrain and can effectively attack the beasts.
Jax: You need to set up flood traps near the river, as these traps can cause the beasts to fall into the river and prevent them from advancing.
Jax: You need to set up traps in the Grand Canal, as this is the only river that serves as the necessary route to the town.
Jax: You need to set up landmine traps and pitfall traps in the forest so that we can use different traps to work together to fend off the beast invasion.

all_response_exaplain: The previous responses from Jax did not explain which traps to set up in the Grand Canyon. This response addresses the question of which trap to use in the Grand Canyon, specifying that rockfall traps are suitable for the canyon terrain and can effectively attack the beasts. Note: Use this response only if the other party has noticed the issue of being unsure which trap to set up in the Grand Canyon.

Jax previously mentioned that traps need to be set up near the river but did not specify which type of trap to use. This response addresses the question of which trap to set up near the river, specifying that flood traps are effective in causing the beasts to fall into the river and preventing them from advancing. Note: Use this response only if the other party has noticed the lack of information on which trap to use near the river.

There are multiple rivers in the game scenario, and the previous response did not specify which river to set up traps in. This response addresses the question of which river to set up traps in, specifying that the Grand Canal is the necessary route to the town and thus the appropriate location for setting up traps. Note: Use this response only if the other party has noticed that there are multiple rivers and is unsure which one to choose.
